content.html:
Choosing a Display Mode

Before
You
Begin

Use 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING to choose from
the following display modes. You can choose separate display
modes for shooting and playback.


1


SHOOTING

OptionDescription
SENSOR EYE SENSORPutting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on.
LCD ONLYLCD monitor on, viewfinder off.
EVF ONLYViewfinder on, LCD monitor off.
EVF ONLY + SENSORPutting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD monitor remains off.
SENSOR EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP.Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting. The options selected for SCREEN SET-UP > IMAGE DISP. apply to display in the LCD monitor.
You can also assign VIEW MODE SETTING to a function button and
use it to switch between the EVF and LCD monitor.

Go to 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING in the setup menu
and press the Q button to choose the view modes available.

14
content.markdown:
# Choosing a Display Mode

Before
You
Begin

Use 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING to choose from
the following display modes. You can choose separate display
modes for shooting and playback.

You can also assign VIEW MODE SETTING to a function button and
use it to switch between the EVF and LCD monitor.

# 1

# SHOOTING

| Option | Description |
| --- | --- |
| SENSOR EYE SENSOR | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on. |
| LCD ONLY | LCD monitor on, viewfinder off. |
| EVF ONLY | Viewfinder on, LCD monitor off. |
| EVF ONLY + SENSOR | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD monitor remains off. |
| SENSOR EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP. | Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting. The options selected for SCREEN SET-UP > IMAGE DISP. apply to display in the LCD monitor. |


Go to 8 SCREEN SET-UP > VIEW MODE SETTING in the setup menu
and press the Q button to choose the view modes available.

14

You can also assign VIEW MODE SETTING to a function button and
use it to switch between the EVF and LCD monitor.

use it to switch between the EVF and LCD monitor.
